author: linoscope
content: <@755590043632140352> To double-check, you believe that we should have a standardized support for off-protocol bids across all clients from the start (not just "up to each clients"), right? As long as we don't bypass the builder signing the bids.

author: potuz
content:
I think we should all agree in supporting this feature exactly as stated:
- The builder API returns along with the bid value, an off-protocol value. 
- The node operator is allowed to whitelist some builder indices as trusted. 
- The CL client will add the off-protocol value to the bid value if the builder index is in the list of whitelisted builders. 

Nothing less and nothing more "standardized". Prysm will also allow for many more configurations along how to chose and when to choose bids, how to blacklist etc. But I think most of this should **not** be specified and forced on clients. I believe the above should be required on clients and it's the minimal support that guarantees a preference for trusted payments.
